stories.title: Six Stanford football players drafted; Skov signs with 49ers as free agent
stories.summary: Six Cardinal football players were picked in the 2014 NFL Draft on Friday and Saturday.

details.text: At least five more players have already signed as unrestricted free agents.
The six selections tie a program record and lead the Pac-12.

questions.text: Was Trent Murphy deserving to go in the Second Round?
Should Shayne Skov have gone undrafted?

stories.title: New Lathrop Library to host Meyer's services
stories.summary: Lathrop Library is currently being renovated to replace Meyer Library.

details.text: Meyer will be closed for the 2014-15 academic year.
Meyer is scheduled to be demolished the following summer.

questions.text: Is the new Lathrop library too far?
Best study spot on campus: Green

stories.title: The economic disparities of being abroad
stories.summary: A student at Stanford University shares his thoughts on socioeconomic status in study abroad programs.

details.text: While Stanford has eliminated the physical barrier for lower-income individuals to study abroad, the expensive spending culture prevalent in many study abroad programs remains in Stanford's. Simple remedies do exist that could mitigate this, though.

questions.text: Does the Stanford community discuss socioeconomic disparities enough?

stories.title: Back on top: Water polo defeats UCLA to win national title
stories.summary: Stanford women's water polo defeated UCLA to win the national title.

details.text: Stanford brought home the fourth national championship in the program's history
This is Stanford's 105th overall NCAA national title.
Stanford has won at least one national title every year for the last 38 years

questions.text: Will the women's tennis team win?
Is the streak secure for years to come?
Can the women's water polo team repeat next year as champions?

stories.title: Stanford's satellite campus to forge bond with Redwood City
stories.summary: Stanford is developing a satellite campus in Redwood City

details.text: The campus will be on a 35-acre plot of land seven miles north of Stanford
The satellite campus will likely be under construction until 2020
The majority of the campus will be "back office" space for administrators

questions.text: Does this affect Stanford's main campus?
Is this good for Redwood City?
Will Stanford free up space on main campus?
Does Redwood City need a stanford addition?
